title:
A digital four-arm bridge for the comparison of resistance with
  capacitance
abstract:
We have built and demonstrated a digital four-arm bridge for the comparison
of resistance with capacitance. The digital four-arm bridge mimics the
classical quad bridge in the digital domain with three balances: the source
balance, the detector balance, as well as the main balance. Due to correlation,
the required precision of the source voltages is only of the order of the
square root of the ultimate bridge precision. For the comparison of a
$100\,$k$\Omega$ resistor with a $1\,$nF capacitor near 1592 Hz, the combined
standard uncertainty $(k = 1)$ is $5\times 10^{-9}$.
